column1: length ball around middle and cutting the batsman in half as Zazai was neither forward nor back, nice carry to the keeper as well
length again, around middle and leg, defends it towards short midwicket, Rabada tumbles in his followthrough but all good. Some repairs at the landing area
a touch fuller this time, around middle and off, Zazai pushes it towards covers without much foot movement
fuller again, just around the off stump, defends it towards cover-point from the crease
short of length on the stumps, 141 kph, but looked like it came slower off the wicket, Zazai was early into the flick, gets struck on the thigh
a full toss on the pads and flicked away behind square leg, off the mark with a boundary
fuller around the off stumps, comes forward and defends confidentially
length ball this time, on the stumps, Noor Ali stays in his crease and drops it at his feet
fuller and angling away this time, Noor Ali looks to push at it, gets beaten
length ball in the corridor, Noor Ali is a bit more watchful this time around, shoulders arms
length ball once more and angling away from the right-hander, left alone once again. Good carry to de Kock
short of length this time and much closer to the batsman, good bounce as well, Noor Ali sways away
length ball on the stumps, Zazai clears his front leg and works it towards backward square leg for a couple
length ball on the stumps, and leaving the batsman, Zazai was once again looking to work it on the leg side, gets squared up
a touch fuller from Rabada this time around, Zazai swipes it away but hits straight towards square leg, on the volley to the fielder
in the air but safe. Length ball and Zazai goes for the pull, fails it middle it but it falls in no man's land towards midwicket
short again, Zazai cannot help but go for the pull, not in the full control but swivels to keep it down, a single to fine leg
length ball in the channel this time, Noor Ali takes a big stride forward before letting it go through
length ball on the stumps and angling in towards the batsman, Zazai flicks it towards fine leg
length ball in the channel and angling away, Noor Ali looks to drive on the up, more of a push to be honest, gets beaten
back of length around off stump, stays back and taps it towards point, still not off the mark
and he is off the mark. Fuller outside off, and Noor Ali finally connects a drive, not from the middle of the bat but enough on it to beat the point fielder on his right and go all the way
fuller again, on middle and leg this time, taps it towards short midwicket for a quick single
short of length but down the leg side, Zazai leaves it alone and collects a wide
short of length on the stumps, dabs it behind square leg for one
short of length around off, goes for the pull but ends up dragging it towards deep square leg
length ball around off, comes forward to block, gets an inside edge on to the pads

length ball around off, pushes it towards extra cover and they are coming back for the second, not the best of the throws, but de Kock does well to deflect it on to the stumps, Noor Ali though as dragging his bat and was home easily
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks. Once again the ball finds the inner half and deflects on to the pads
a touch fuller and in the corridor, Noor Ali pushes at it, a thick outside edge travels between slips and gully

length ball around off and Zazai once again clears his front leg and goes for the pull, ends up top-edging it towards midwicket, Morris chases it from mid-on but the ball is always going away from him. Gets his fingers to it but the ball keeps travelling towards the boundary line. Van der Dussen puts in a desperate dive but cannot prevent the boundary
fuller around off and goes for the drive, it was in the air but between cover and point and that's back to back four for Afghanistan
length ball on the stumps, gets behind the line and defends it on the leg side
length again, around middle and off, defended on the off side this time
length ball around off, comes forward this time and opens the face of the bat to defend it towards covers
length ball but on the pads, glanced towards fine leg for four more
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives it back towards the bowler
length ball on the stumps, dabs it towards midwicket for a quick single
short of length around off, gets on the back foot and looks to punch it through extra cover, mistimes it towards the bowler
short of length outside off, gets on his toes and taps it towards point
snorter! Length ball outside off, takes off after landing, Noor Ali does well to pull his bat away in the end, de Kock collecting it near head height
and again! Another length ball around off and once again some extra bounce for Rabada, Noor Ali pushes at it and gets beaten
short of length in the channel, too far from the batsman to invite any interest, left alone
fuller on the stumps and angling in, Zazai misses the flick and gets beaten. An appeal for lbw but was going down clearly
goes for the yorker but the line is outside off, Zazai looks to jam his bat at it, misses
short of length outside off, Zazai goes for the cut but it's too close to him and also he's late on the shot, gets an edge but well short of de Kock
slapped through extra cover! Length ball outside off, Zazai backs away and flat-bats it through the off side for four
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards the right of short fine leg for one
short of length and moving away from the batsman, who takes his eyes off and sways away
short of length on the pads, looks to flick it away and misses, gets hit on the thigh

finally South Africa get their field positions right! Length ball around off, Zazai knows one way to deal with those, backs away and goes for the pull, doesn't quite middle it and van der Dussen takes a low catch sliding in from deep midwicket
length ball around off, defends it from the back foot
short of length outside off, in the corridor, left alone
short of length around off, stays back and defends it towards covers
short of length around off, defends it towards cover-point with an face
short of length outside off, Noor Ali sways away from the line
length ball around off, pushes at it but the bat turns in his hands, was in the air for a bit but well short of the bowler
short of length outside off, defends it on the off side from the back foot
short of length outside off, stays beside the line and dabs it towards cover-point
short of length outside off, and whipped past the diving cover fielder on left for four
a touch fuller outside off this time, and Noor Ali goes for another drive, in the air this time as he ends up slicing it. Well short of the point fielder
length ball around off, comes forward and offers a solid defence
length ball in the channel, sixth-stump line, shouldered arms after a big stride forward
fuller around off, comes forward and drives but fails to beat the cover fielder

fuller and much closer to the batsman this time, Rahmat Ali comes forward and turns it towards midwicket, Morris sprints in from mid-on and has a shy at the bowler's end. A direct hit and Rahmat would have been on his way back. Instead he's off the mark

did it carry? Doesn't look like. Length ball outside off, Noor Ali moves towards the ball and pushes at it, gets an outside edge but looks like it landed just short of du Plessis at second slip. He's not sure and they are going upstairs. Soft signal is not out and it stays not out as replays show it was just short of du Plessis
length ball outside off, stays back and punches it towards extra cover
length ball outside off, goes for the drive and misses as the ball jump up after landing
length ball in the corridor, shouldered arms. Rahmat Shah, as usual, is in no hurry
fuller on the stumps, looks to flick it on the leg side, gets an inside edge on to the pads
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards short midwicket
fuller around off, comes forward and offers a copybook front-foot defence
length ball outside off and another outside edge as Rahmat is stuck at the crease. De Kock was moving towards the leg side and cannot reach there in time. For Amla first slip, it lands too short
length ball outside off, left alone by the batsman this time
short of length around off, defended towards cover-point from crease
length ball around off, stays on the back foot and defends on the off side
another length ball in the channel, pushes it towards point from the crease
fuller around off, comes forward and steers it towards third man by opening the face of the bat at the last moment
short and way outside off, tennis-ball like bounce. Noor Ali leaves it alone, a glance at the square leg umpire in hope of a wide, but not called
length ball around off, comes half-forward and defends
length ball around off, defends it with an open face towards point
fuller on the stumps and driven back towards the left of the bowler, was in the air for a while but Morris cannot reach there, the mid-off chases it all the way and pushes it just inside
length ball on the stumps, gets behind this and pushes it towards short midwicket
beauty! At 142kph. Length ball around off, coming in with the angle moving just away off the seam to beat the outside edge
short, attempted bouncer but Noor Ali picks it up early and pulls it over square leg for four, that brings up the fifty as well for Afghanistan
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards backward square leg for one
length ball in the corridor, left alone
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it gently between the stumps and the non-striker, mid-on cuts it off
short of length outside off, steered past the point fielder for a couple
bouncer on middle and leg, Noor Ali had no problem in ducking under that
short of length outside off, looks to push at it, gets an outside edge but there is only one slip where Amla can just watch it go towards third man, a tumbling stop there by Tahir to keep it to two

fuller on the stumps, Rahmat Shah looks to flick it away and misses, struck in front and given. Rahmat has a discussion with his partner goes for the review just in time. The only question is if it was heading down. Pitched in line, impact in front of middle and leg, and would have gone on to just clip the leg stump. Umpire's call there and that means Rahmat has to walk back
length ball and angling away, Shahidi pushes at it and gets beaten
shortens his length a bit this time and much closer to the batsman, gets struck high on the bat
length ball on middle and leg, dabs it towards square leg
fuller around off, was looking to defend first before changing his mind, tries to leave but too late. The ball hits the face of the bat and dribbles towards third man
a thick outside edge past backward point, was fuller around off, Noor Ali was looking to flick it through the leg side, gets lucky and collects a couple of runs to the right of third man
length ball around off, stays in the crease and defends it towards cover-point
a touch fuller on the stumps, gets behind this and blocks down the wicket
short and wide, cuts it off the back foot, beating the diving backward point on his left
fuller around off this time and Noor Ali brings out the extra-cover drive, gets a good stride in but somehow doesn't get enough power behind it, mid-off cuts it off
short of length around off, sways away from the line
fuller outside off, squeezes it towards point, no run though
full and straight, in the slot for a drive, but one hand comes off the bat as it is mistimed into the covers
pounding out a good length outside off, shaping towards the cordon and left well alone
ploughing away outside off again, another judicious leave from a very determined and watchful Hashmatullah
lays bat on ball this time, an uppish waft out to short cover
short and sharp, Hasmatullah leans inside the line to leave it alone
shoulders arms once more... intriguing tactics. Morris to be fair was very threatening in his first spell. Maybe Afghanistan have decided he's the man to be feared today
driven with intent to mid-off, can't pierce the field

absolutely plumb! Full, straight, shaping in... a waft across the line, and I can't believe they are reviewing this one! Aha ... there was a tickle of an inside edge! That'd be why then! He had a chat with Hashmatullah before reviewing, which suggests he wasn't sure he'd hit it either!
fast and back of a length, zipping through to the keeper, once again no stroke
blotted back down the track, solid in defence once more
flicked from outside off down to third man, a deft swish of the wrists
no stroke once more. The cautious approach continues ...
a touch of inswing on a good length, shaves inside a loose drive, through to the keeper
another leave-alone ... whatever the plan is, it isn't changing in a hurry
tighter to the pads, nudged off the hip down the leg side
shaping across the left-hander, Hashmatullah draws his bat inside the line to leave alone
on the legs again, tucked into the gap
an extra grunt of effort behind that delivery, as Noor is beaten by a beauty outside off, that really climbed off the deck
outside off, curling away, through to the keeper with no stroke offered
tight line to off stump, stabbed into the covers with minimum footwork
up on the toes, squeezed through point

driven, with hard hands, outside off, and a fat edge is gobbled at slip! Precisely the restart that South Africa needed. Hasmatullah was lured by one that seemed just that touch too close to leave alone, but the angle kept taking it away from his best intentions
over the wicket, tight line to the right-hander, who props forward to block
cracked out to point, no way through there

bowled him first ball! That's a massive arrival, a ripper of a googly, pitch-perfect, on off stump, twisting through the gate as Noor has no idea what's hit him. Catch me if you can, you can imagine the rest from Tahir!
tossed up, onto the toes, flicked to the leg side to get off the mark
lovely areas once more from Tahir, poked cautiously into the covers
nudged forward with caution

looped up, leading edge, Tahir gobbles the catch in his followthrough and flees the scene as if he's just scrumped an apple from an angry farmer! This is an utter meltdown from Afghanistan, completely unsettled by the interruption. Asghar was playing across the line outside off, again no clue which way the ball was biting. There's trouble at t'mill now...
chopped firmly out to point, the end of an eventful over!

back of a length, outside off, a flaccid waft of a cut, and he's only gone and wrecked his own stumps! Nabi was the glue in this lower order, the man who might be relied upon to rebuild. But that was too close to cut and the under-edge does the rest!
firmly punched off the back foot out to third man, off the mark with some confidence
wider on the crease, fired in towards off stump. Blocked to cover
banged in short, sways inside the line
back and across, nudged to the leg side
short and lifting sharply past the nose as Ikram sways
looped up, into the blockhole. Defended
flicked to the leg side, from deep in the crease
belted square, out to point who gets behind the ball well
beaten in the flight, but adjusts well to crunch a drive past short cover
outside off, poked to point off the back foot
round the wicket to finish the over, another probing full length, clipped back to the bowler
nibbles off the seam, past the left-hander's edge. Phehlukwayo is enjoying these conditions, just offering a little to his line of attack
once again, seaming past the outside edge as Ikram pushes hard
this is a lovely set of deliveries, hitting a good length and letting the ball blab as it climbs past the edge
angled defence through backward point
fully forward, angled into the gap on the leg side
firmly blocked once more, an excellent over in the midst of an excellent spell
plonked to mid-on

a filthy long-hop, an outstanding pluck! Absolutely nothing is going for Afghanistan! Tahir let one slip, halfway down the track, all the time in the world for Gulbadin to pick his spot. But he chose a telegraphed spank through midwicket, and Aiden Markram reached high above his head to pluck down a blinder in both hands!
on the back foot, punched with an open face to short cover
full length once more, dipping on the left-hander's off stump and deflected to the leg side
stretching forward and blocked back down the pitch
another googly, twisting from a middle-and-leg line and blocked to cover
full length, speared into the toes and clipped to deep midwicket
fenced through third man as Rabada drags his length back by half a yard
quality shot! They've been a rarity in this innings, but that is a truly pleasing cover drive, high elbow, full face, into the gap
back-to-back boundaries! But he doesn't know much about this one, a flimsy drive, inside-edged over his leg stump!
solidly forward and another good-looking drive straight to the man this time
fuller, faster, 137kph, thumps the pad as it angles down the leg side
fully forward to block
tapped to mid-on
attempted sweep, deflects off the knee! Outside the line so no appeal, but Amla at slip can't intercept
lots more air, guided cautiously back to the bowler
belted through the covers, a half-stop cuts off the boundary as the sweeper tidies up
round the wicket, firmly struck through the line of the ball, for mid-on to gather
sharp pace on a tight line across the left-hander, who drops his hands to let it pass
blotted through third man, vertical bat with an open face
short and sharp, but sliding down the leg side as Rashid ducks
another bouncer, good aggression but leg-sided again. A yorker in the pipeline?
length this time, as Rashid swings into a violently ambitious pull but can't connect
fiercely drilled to mid-off, quality connection but hits the fielder
formidable bludgeoning! That's the Afghanistan we know and love! Clearing the front foot, cowboy-ing through the line and dispatching a murderous drive through the covers!
another huge wind-up, no connection, but the intent is plain! Now, just imagine if they still had eight wickets in hand with this mindset brewing...
poked into the off side
flicked back to the bowler, meeting the full length
hopping onto the back foot, defended with intent
lots of air, dipping on the crease, luring a smoked kipper of a lofted slog, inches short of short midwicket!
back of a length, poked wide of point for the single
back of a length, slapped on one knee through cow corner. Effective thwacking
short and to the point! A sharp lifter from just back of a length, cracks the gloves as Rashid chooses to stay in line for once...
a lusty swing across the line as Rashid reverts to Plan B(iff-it)
outside off, nipping off the seam, through to the keeper
round the wicket, cramping the left-hander with a tighter line into the stumps. Uneasily blocked down into the crease
back of a length, climbs past the edge as Ikram curtain-rails his bat inside the line
ripper! Nibbling off the deck from a full length outside off, genuinely beaten on the back foot
thumped down the ground, meeting the low full toss with a loose swing through the line
advancing to the pitch, a massive wind-up and an impressive-looking clump down the ground, but plugs inside the rope for long-on to gather
drilled with intent through the covers, another purposeful swing of the bat  but the sweeper gathers
poked to point for the single
cracked with a baseball swing out to deep midwicket, gathered on the bounce. Lucky he didn't connect better with that one...
nudged to the off side, a mild panic in the running between the wickets, but they get home safely enough
round the wicket, hitting the deck hard, defended from the back foot
tight line on the left-hander's off stump. Blocked once more with a cordon of two slips lurking
flipped off a full length to mid-on

edged and gone! Morris earns his reward for line and length, slanting into the left-hander, demanding a shot, and just nipping away enough to be taken in the bread-basket of first slip. Routine dismissal, and South Africa's post-rain rampage picks up pace again
over the wicket, tailing into the right-hander, solid block and a bit of a mix-up in the running. Rashid isn't interested
yee-har! Well, why not... very full, have a slash, what's the worst that could happen? Well, it somehow misses the stumps, so not that ...
swept with authority through backward square! That's lovely timing and placement
swept again, beats the field again! A touch more hurried, a quicker slider, but it was missing leg, and Rashid helps it on its way
retreats to leg, spanks over point! This is fun, who cares where it goes, so long as it goes! Not fully timed, but the runs are flowing...
in to out, and battered through the covers! This is brilliant entertainment, taking the fight back to South Africa

crashed over the leg side, but van der Dussen is right back on the rope! It was a quicker delivery, and Rashid picked it well, but he needed to get under the ball more to clear deep midwicket. That's probably curtains for Afghanistan, but it was fun while it lasted...

massive appeal! And up they go for the review! It looked to be smashing the stumps, little doubt there, but was there inside-edge? No there wasn't ... and there was doubt after all! Missing leg, and on we go...

slogged into the sky to seal the deal! That was short and to the point. Back of a length, whack it wherever ... except straight up in the air of course. Any number of fielders could have converged, but the skipper took responsibility, standing almost on the umpire's toes to gather.
length ball in the corridor, left alone by Amla
length once more, but way outside off. Amla, who has taken a leg-stump guard, is not interested
straighter this time, once again on the similar length, punches it towards short midwicket
on the pads this time, Amla goes for the flick but misses, a leg-bye as the ball rolls to the left of the keeper
short of length around off, de Kock was looking to play but withdraws at the last moment as the ball jumps at him after landing
angling in towards the batsman, pitched on a length and kept coming in, de Kock shoulders arms, and the ball passes over the stumps, Ikram fumbles a bit behind the stumps while collecting
length ball around off, defended from the back foot
a touch fuller and Amla goes for the drive, cannot get past the cover fielder
short of length outside off, Hassan too getting that extra bounce, left alone by Amla
short of length around off, Amla gets on his toes and punches it towards short midwicket
short of length outside off, punches it behind point for one

length ball around off, de Kock pushes at it, gets an inside edge on to the pads, a bit of hesitation as the ball rolls towards covers, the fielder was quick to the ball but de Kock hares down the other end and makes it easily in the end
fuller around off, comes forward and flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball around off, looks to punch it down the ground, gets an inside edge over the stumps, a lucky boundary to fine leg
length ball outside off, a bit of away movement off the seam, left alone by Amla
length again, but still outside off, no movement as Amla shoulders arms once more
length around off, comes forward and defends solidly towards covers
length ball on the pads, Amla goes for the flick but misses and is struck on the thigh
length ball outside off, looks to drive on the up but ends up chopping down towards extra cover
length ball outside off, de Kock was looking to play at it but changes his mind in the end
short of length outside off, opens the face this time to guide it towards third man
fuller around off stumps, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off, finds the fielder with pin-point accuracy
fuller again, drives it towards the left of mid-off this time, only a single though
short of length outside off, dabs it down towards third man once more
length ball on the stumps, de Kock stays back and blocks
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards square leg for one
short of length outside off, Amla goes for the cut but ends up chopping it towards covers

length ball around off, better timing on the punch this time, the cover fielder makes a good stop to his left and fires in the throw at the bowler's end, backup is not great and that means an extra run to South Africa and Amla

length ball on middle and leg, Amla once again fails to connect the flick. An appeal for lbw but not given. Was heading down it looked like but Afghanistan want to review this. Replays confirm it would have missed the leg stump easily
short and Amla swivels to pull this one, not in full control though. Dribbles towards fine leg
length ball in the corridor, left alone by Amla. He's taking his time here
another short one, 137kph, Amla goes for the pull but was late on the shot, gets an inside edge on to the body
short of length outside off and moving away, Amla sways away from the line
short of length outside off, Amla rises with the bounce and punches it towards cover-point
short of length on the stumps, looks to work on the leg side, gets an inside edge on to the pads
length ball around off, Amla dabs it towards towards square leg off the back foot
short of length outside off, looks to flick it towards midwicket, gets an inside edge on to the pads
short of length outside off, surprises de Kock by the movement and extra bounce who was looking to push it on the off side, withdraws his bat a bit
length ball on the stumps, de Kock stays back and defends
short of length outside off, punches it towards point, straight towards the fielder
short of length around off, de Kock stands tall and punches it back towards the bowler. That's 11 dots in a row, de Kock is a bit frustrated
fuller around off and de Kock drives it through extra cover, finds the gap and the boundary to break the shackles
length ball in the corridor, left alone by Amla
short of length around off, Amla goes back and across and taps it towards square leg for a quick single
a tad fuller around off, drives it towards extra cover, didn't middle it though
length ball outside off, left alone by Amla once more
fuller on the stumps and Amla shows his class this time with an on-drive, presents the full face of the bat and the ball races away towards the boundary
short of length around off, Amla looks to duck first but realises it's not bouncing much and drops his hand as well. That's the benefit of keeping your eyes on the ball
starts with a short one and de Kock doesn't miss out. Rocks back and pulls it towards the vacant deep midwicket area for four
short again but quicker as well, 97kph. De Kock goes back and punches it towards extra cover
a googly this time from Rashid, defended from the back foot
length ball around off, de Kock goes back and looks to turn it towards short fine leg, gets an inside edge on to the pads
length ball around middle, taps it towards short fine leg off the back foot
a touch fuller on the stumps, de Kock comes forward and pushes it past short midwicket, and gets a single to long-on
fuller on the stumps, drives inside out towards mid-off
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and taps it towards short midwicket
a touch fuller around off this time, de Kock skips down and looks to go over mid-off, gets an thick outside edge towards third man, the ball spinning past Asghar at third man
length ball on the stumps, pushes it towards short midwicket from the front foot
short of length outside off, punches it towards the left of Asghar this time who covers the ground quickly to keep it to one
short of length outside off, looks to punch on the off side, ends up chopping it into the ground
short of length outside off, a googly. De Kock slices it towards short third man
length ball around off, punches it off the back foot towards short third man, gets a single this time
length ball around off, punches it back towards the bowler
fuller on the pads, turns it towards square leg
a full toss on the stumps, thumps it towards the left of long-on for a couple
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
a slower one on the pads, de Kock places it towards midwicket and comes back for the second as the midwicket fielder is at the boundary
length ball on the stumps, pushes it on the leg side
short of length outside off, de Kock goes back and off ground to pull it towards long-on
short of length outside off, doesn't bounce that much, Amla pulls it towards deep square leg, fielder there
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it towards long-on
short of length outside off, pushes it towards backward point
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards deep square leg
short of length around off, a quicker one at 94kph. Amla goes back to cut and gets beaten
too full this time, on the stumps, Amla drives it back towards the bowler, Rashid dives to his right, gets his fingers to it. Just a single to long-on in the end
length ball around off, defended from the crease
length ball around off, de Kock goes back and cuts it behind point for a couple
short of length outside off, goes for the cut, gets an outside edge that races past short third man
short of length outside off, punches it towards cover-point for one
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg for one
fuller outside off, opens the face of the bat to steer it towards point
short of length outside off, goes back and punches it behind point for one more
short of length on the stumps, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, angling in to cramp the batsman, Amla dabs it down the wicket
short of length on the stumps, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg
fuller around off, de Kock looks to drive it through extra cover, gets a thick outside edge towards point, a bit of sloppy work allows an extra run
fuller around off, pushes it on the off side
fuller once more, on the stumps this time, de Kock pushes it back
pitched up on the pads, flicks it towards deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, punches it down the wicket off the back foot
fuller around off, de Kock pushes it towards covers
length ball around off, de Kock looks to cut it square, gets an inside edge into the ground
length ball outside off, cuts it straight towards short third man
arm ball, length around off and keeps coming in with the angle, de Kock gets his bat down in time
length outside off, steers it towards extra cover for one
slower in the air, length ball around off, Amla defends from the crease
fuller around off, de Kock goes down on one knee and and slog sweeps it towards deep midwicket for four
short of length outside off, chops it towards short third man, a bit of misfield there and they come back for the second
length ball around off, a googly perhaps, de Kock goes back and works it towards square leg
a touch fuller around off, de Kock was once again on the back foot, looks to punch it on the off side, gets an inside edge on to the pads
fuller and flatter at 95kph, de Kock comes forward and blocks
and gets to his fifty in style. Fuller around off and de Kock goes aerial, over midwicket for four more
fuller around off, Amla comes forward and looks to work it on the leg side, gets a thick outside edge behind point
fuller around off, worked away towards square leg from the front foot
brings out the reverse sweep, a premeditated one to a delivery fuller around off, beats short third man
length ball around off, stays back and defends
fuller on the pads, turned away towards square leg
pitched up on the stumps, flicks it towards deep square leg
short of length around off and middle, goes back and dabs it towards square leg, de Kock was eager for a single but Amla sends him back
a touch fuller around off, looks to smash it through covers but loses his shape, the ball hits the inner half and rolls on the leg side
length ball around off, Amla plays it late this time, steering it towards sweeper cover
short of length around middle and leg, de Kock goes for an aerial pull, one-bounce to Rahmat at deep midwicket but makes a complete mess of it and lets it go through
a slower one on the pads, flicked along the ground this time, Rahmat does better this time
length ball around off, Amla was stuck in his crease, does well to get his bat down in time
floated around off, de Kock skips down and looks to work it on the leg side, an inside edge on to the pads
fuller and wider this time, driven towards deep extra cover but only one there
length ball around off, Amla moves back and across and looks to flick it away, mistimes it
Amla playing some unorthodox shots here, fuller around off, Amla goes deep and lofts it behind square leg for four
length ball around off, defended down from the back foot
length ball around off and drifting away, Amla looks to push at it and gets beaten
full length, on off stump, steered with an open face through backward point
solidly into line, on off stump
tapped into the off side, a scampered single
swinging into the blockhole, clubbed to short midwicket where it is stopped with a tumble
clouted up and over the leg side! Didn't get a proper hold on it, but that was dangled outside off stump and boshed with glee into space at long-on
into the toes, deflected behind square
a slow-turning offbreak, outside off, tapped to backward point
round the wicket, looped into the slot, de Kock yawns into a one-kneed dump over the leg side, but doesn't get a hold of it
outside off, a bit of a harsh wide as de Kock misses with another smear
on the pads, nudged into the gap
firmly forward, head over the ball on off stump
clipped firmly to mid-on, a slight fumble allows the single
on the legs, can't pick the gap this time
eased into the covers
fails to find the gap on the off side this time
cracked with intent out to the cover sweeper and up comes the hundred, and the hundred stand
slammed off the pads. De Kock is getting bored of circumspection

belted through the leg side, but that's a stunning intercept! Mohammad Nabi at midwicket, reaches to his right, snaffles a fast-travelling slap off the toes, de Kock is a bit stunned by that, he thought he'd picked his spot well enough
into the toes, drilled on the up into the leg-side
firmly into line to block
looped up outside off stump, pushed to cover
googly, hard to read that one, and Amla barely does ... squirts it away through the leg side in a tangle of limbs
more confidently into the covers this time
slides down the leg side, but he was a long way across his stumps
reverse sweep, a trademark stroke, not quite nailed
pushed onto the back foot to defend
leans back for the cut, placed out to the cover sweeper
an ambitious mow, dribbles to the leg side
on the back foot, blocked to mid-on
head right over the ball, a full-faced block. Proper cricket!
more lift off the deck outside off as Nabi slides this on with the arm. Amla is beaten on the cut
worked back towards the bowler, on the leg side. Tidy over
slammed into the leg side! From nowhere, fireworks!
on the back foot, pushed to cover
right behind the ball, blocked again
a bottom-handed flick to long-on. Lalalalala ...
reverses the hands for the sweep, misses
hurrah, he's nailed another one! Back of a length, banged through cover with a scything cut
solidly into line. Red ink or bust
go on Hash, treat yourself ... nope, another watchful nudge
clipped off the pads to square leg
lots of air, launched down to long-off ... there's fielder lurking but it falls just short!
cracked down the ground to long-off once more... I think even the rain would be getting bored now
on the legs, can't get this one away
driven with no footwork, into the off side
cheeky ... a slower-ball bouncer, loops into Amla's arc, so he opens the face to run a single to third man
bouncer, and Andile sways inside the line
short once more, too short this time as Phehlukwayo doesn't even think of a stroke
yorker! Well bowled, right into the toes, dug out with no idea where the ball has ended up. Right at his feet is the answer ...
fired down the leg side ... very delayed from the umpire, who was perhaps wondering if the ball had clipped the pad
full and straight, and pushed to mid-off ... for the love of God ... won't someone have a swing!
there's the ambitious swing! But he completely loses his shape as the ball dribbles to midwicket.
nope, no contact.
flicked to leg ...
solid front-foot forward defence! Impeccable!
woo-hoo! Down the ground and into the stands! South Africa gallop to a nine-wicket win with a massive 21.2 overs to spare! At least, that's what the scorecard will say at any rate...
